hints.content:
There are $\goldE{25\text { L}}$ of yellow paint.

[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: A graduated cylinder with tick marks from 5 liters to 30 liters. Tick marks 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30 liters are labeled. The yellow paint inside the graduated cylinder measures to the 25 liters tick mark. A line extends from the 25 liters tick mark and is labeled 25 liters. !

hints.content:
To find the amount of paint Chioma has left, we subtract the number of $\text{L}$ used to paint walls $(\blueD{14} \text { L})$ from the number of liters Chioma started with$(\goldE{25} \text { L})$.


[[☃ image 1]]

options.alt: Two rectangles sit on top of each other. The top rectangle is labeled 25 liters. A curved bracket across the top rectangle is labeled Total liters of paint. The bottom rectangle is divided into 2 parts. The longer left part is labeled 14 liters. The shorter right part is labeled with a question mark. A curved bracket across the longer left part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Paint used. A curved bracket across the shorter right part of the bottom rectangle is labeled Paint left. !

hints.content: Chioma has $\greenD{11}\text { L}$ of yellow paint left.

question.content:
Chioma loves yellow!  She buys a container with the amount of yellow paint shown below.  She uses $14$ liters of paint to paint her walls.

[[☃ image 1]]

**How much yellow paint does Chioma have left?**  

[[☃ input-number 1]] liters

options.alt: A graduated cylinder with tick marks from 5 liters to 30 liters. Tick marks 5, 10, 15, 20, 25, and 30 liters are labeled. The yellow paint inside the graduated cylinder measures to the 25 liters tick mark. !
